metadata.chief_complaint: sports physical, conversation tangents to vaping, friend drama, knee pain, confidential time reveals girlfriend concerns

teen.style: typical teenager, guarded then opens up

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Hey Jake, Mrs. Patterson. Sports physical today?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yes, he needs it for basketball tryouts next month.

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Yeah. Can we make this quick? I have practice.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I'll do my best. So how's school going?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Fine. Whatever.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: He's doing great actually. Honor roll last semester.

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Mom.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's awesome, Jake. Any health concerns I should know about before basketball?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: No. I'm good.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Tell her about your knee.

script.speaker: teen
script.text: It's nothing. It just hurts sometimes.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Which knee? What kind of pain?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Right one. Below my kneecap. Only when I run a lot.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: How long has that been going on?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Like a few months maybe? I don't know. Hey did you hear Tyler broke his ankle? He's out for the whole season.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's rough. I'll look at your knee in a minute. Let me ask you about some other stuff first. Any headaches, chest pain with exercise, passing out?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: No, nothing like that.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good. Any smoking or vaping?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: No.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: There better not be.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Mrs. Patterson, I'm going to ask Jake some questions privately in a few minutes, which is standard for teens. Nothing to worry about.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Of course. I know the drill. My older one did this too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Jake, let me examine you first.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Blood pressure is 118 over 72. Pulse is 66. You're in good shape. Height is five foot ten, weight 155. BMI is 22, right in the healthy range.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Heart sounds normal. No murmur. Lungs clear. Let me check that knee.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: This one? Does this hurt when I press here?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Yeah, right there. Ow.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's the tibial tubercle. Classic spot for Osgood-Schlatter disease. It's a growth-related issue, very common in athletic teens.

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Is it serious?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: No. It usually resolves when you stop growing. Ice after activity, stretching your quads, and ibuprofen as needed should help. No restrictions on sports.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Oh good, he'd be devastated if he couldn't play.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: He's cleared for sports. Mrs. Patterson, would you mind stepping out for a few minutes?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Sure. I'll be in the waiting room.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Jake, anything you say here stays between us unless you're hurting yourself or someone else. Got it?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Yeah.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: So, for real, any vaping or smoking? Weed? Alcohol?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Okay, I've vaped like a few times at parties. But I don't like it.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Thanks for being honest. Even occasional vaping can affect your lungs, especially as an athlete. Try to stay away from it.

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Yeah, I know. My coach would kill me.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Any alcohol or drugs?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Beer at a party once. That's it. I don't do drugs.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Okay. What about relationships? Are you dating anyone?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Um, yeah. I have a girlfriend.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Cool. Are you guys sexually active?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Sort of. I mean, we've done stuff but not like... everything.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Thanks for telling me. Whatever you're doing, are you using protection?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Yeah. I mean, when we... yeah.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good. If things progress, condoms every time. And she should be on birth control too. Do you have access to condoms?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Yeah. I'm not dumb.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: I know you're not. Just making sure. Anything else going on you want to talk about? How's your mood been?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: Fine. Tired because of practice and homework. But fine.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Ever feel really down or like you don't want to be around?

script.speaker: teen
script.text: No, nothing like that. Just normal stress.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good. You've got my number if anything comes up. I'll bring your mom back in.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Everything okay?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: All good. Jake's cleared for basketball. The knee is Osgood-Schlatter, ice and ibuprofen as needed. No restrictions.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Thank you, Doctor.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good luck at tryouts, Jake.
